title: Gia Giudice Hints at Tension with Kody Brown on “Special Forces ”as She Admits 'Some People Would Get Under Your Skin'
description: The show's upcoming fourth season will premiere on Sept. 25
content:
NEED TO KNOW
• None Gia Giudice hinted at tension between the Special Forces: World's Toughest Test season 4 cast and Sister Wives star Kody Brown
• None During the Aug. 8 episode of her Casual Chaos podcast, Gia said there were "definitely some people that would get under your skin a little bit" while discussing the cast dynamics
• None Kody's casting has sparked lots of conversation online, with fellow season 4 star Brianna “Chickenfry” LaPaglia even admitting they didn't "get along well"

Gia Giudice is shedding light on the dynamics of the Special Forces: World's Toughest Test cast.

During the Friday, Aug. 8 episode of her Casual Chaos podcast, Gia opened up about her time on the show, just two days after it was announced that she would be competing on season 4.

"I can’t even name one person that I really did not get along with on this cast,” the Real Housewives of New Jersey, 24, star shared on the podcast.

However, Gia added that there were "definitely some people that would get under your skin a little bit, and you guys will see that on the show.”

She appeared to be alluding to Sister Wives star Kody Brown, whose inclusion in the season 4 cast of Special Forces continues to spark conversation online.

Noting that "you guys have all been talking about him already," the Next Gen NYC star added, "So, I’m sure you could assume who it is."

Brown is best known for starring on TLC's Sister Wives.

His casting sparked conversation online as it comes following the end of his polygamous marriages to Meri Brown, Christine Brown and Janelle Brown.

His divorces from Meri, Christine and Janelle all imploded within a 14-month period. He's now only married to Robyn Brown, whom he legally wed in 2014 after their spiritual marriage occurred in 2010. Kody's relationship with his 18 children have also been a topic of debate amongst fans of the show.

But the fans weren't the only people that reacted negatively to Kody's casting. His fellow season 4 castmate, Brianna “Chickenfry” LaPaglia, also weighed in and revealed she experienced tension with the Sister Wives star while filming.

“Let’s just say I didn’t know who he was while filming,” she wrote in a since-expired Instagram Story, according to US Weekly. “And we didn’t necessarily ~get along well~ lmao you will see.”



Special Forces follows a group of celebrities who are shipped off to a foreign country and participate in various challenges that mimic military training.

In addition to Gia, Kody and Brianna, the cast includes Real Housewives of New Jersey star Teresa Giudice, Olympic gymnast Shawn Johnson East and her husband, former NFL athlete Andrew East; and singer Jessie James Decker and her husband, former NFL athlete Eric Decker.

Rounding out the cast is Empire alum Jussie Smollett, The Valley star Brittany Cartwright, The Real Housewives of Atlanta alum Eva Marcille, model Chanel Iman, Transformers actor Ravi V. Patel and Montana Boyz TikToker Mark Estes.

Speaking about her experience, Gia said, “The rest of the cast was really amazing. Everyone was so strong, so motivating. And I think we all motivated each other in some way. I would say we were a really strong team.”

Gia also raved about starring on the show opposite her mom. "It’s not every day that you get to say that you have done some of the craziest tasks and challenges with your mom," she said.

“This is definitely an experience that I will hold very close to my heart and remember forever, that I was able to do this with her," she added.

Special Forces: World's Toughest Test season 4 premieres on Thursday, Sept. 25 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on Fox.

Speaking on her Casual Chaos podcast, Gia stated that there were some people who would "get under your skin" while discussing the cast dynamics. Kody's casting has sparked discussion online, with fellow season 4 star Brianna “Chickenfry” LaPaglia admitting they didn't "get along well" during filming. The cast includes Real Housewives of New Jersey, Olympic gymnast Shawn Johnson East and her husband, former NFL athlete Andrew East, and singer Jessie James Decker.
shortSummary: Gia Giudice discussed tension between the Special Forces: World's Toughest Test cast and Sister Wives star Kody Brown, sparking controversy online.

scraped_sources.text: The Valley Cast Was 'Absolutely Blindsided' by Jax Taylor's Exit from Season 3: 'A Huge Surprise' (Exclusive Source) "They were not given any advance notifications about his exit," a source tells PEOPLE By Brianne Tracy Brianne Tracy Brianne Tracy is a Staff Editor at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2016. People Editorial Guidelines Published on July 16, 2025 02:39PM EDT 28 Comments Jax Taylor. Credit : Charles Sykes/Bravo via Getty NEED TO KNOW A source tells PEOPLE that The Valley cast was "absolutely blindsided by the news" of Jax Taylor's departure from the show Taylor said in a statement on July 16 that he'd be "stepping away" to focus on his sobriety The source says the cast was "not given any advance notifications about his exit" and that the news came as "a huge surprise" The Valley cast was just as shocked as fans to learn about Jax Taylor's exit from the show. On Wednesday, July 16, Taylor, 46, revealed in a statement that he would be "stepping away from the next season of The Valley" to focus on his sobriety, and a source tells PEOPLE the "cast was absolutely blindsided by this news." "They were not given any advance notifications about his exit," says the source. "Most of the cast were notified that filming was going to begin at the end of the summer, and they expected Jax would be a part of the new season because — even as lately as yesterday — he hadn't said otherwise. This is a huge surprise." Bravo has not commented on Taylor's departure. In his statement, Taylor said that his decision to leave the show came "after an incredibly challenging year," as well as "many honest conversations with my team and producers." Taylor entered an in-patient facility for mental health and addiction struggles in August 2024, six months after announcing his separation from his estranged wife and fellow The Valley castmate Brittany Cartwright, with whom he shares Cruz, 4. While in the facility, Cartwright, 36, filed for divorce. "Right now, my focus needs to be on my sobriety, my mental health, and coparenting," Taylor said in his statement. "Taking this time is necessary for me to become the best version of myself — especially for our son, Cruz." Jax Taylor, Brittany Cartwright and their son Cruz. Gabe Ginsberg/Getty During a March podcast appearance, Taylor revealed his longtime struggles with cocaine addiction. Taylor admitted that it was "hard" to reveal his substance abuse issues "out loud." "I’ve been dealing with this on and off since I was 23 and now I’m 45," he said. "There was times where I would stop doing it but then there were times where I’d go heavy on it.” “I’ve never said this in my life," he continued. "So to come out and say that I have an addiction [and] that I have a sickness that I have to work on the rest of my life is a really big deal for me. Obviously, it’s a huge weight lifted off my shoulders.” Related Stories Jax Taylor Announces He Is 'Stepping Away' from 'The Valley' to Focus on His Sobriety: 'This Time Is Necessary' Jax Taylor Says He Is 'Feeling Great' amid Sobriety and 'Will Not Touch Drugs and Alcohol Again' (Exclusive) Cartwright told PEOPLE in April that she’d had “enough” of Taylor’s “come downs” related to his substance abuse issues leading up to their separation. Cartwright said things with Taylor "got so bad" that she "had to take Cruz out of the house." "He was just so aggressive and horrible to me, yelling at me in front of our son,” she said. After they split, “he just spiraled out of control,” she said. "There was no possible way that we were going to meet back in the middle again." Jax Taylor and Brittany Cartwright. Noam Galai/Bravo via Getty Images Cartwright's decision to file for divorce while Taylor was in the facility was depicted in the current second season of The Valley. In the June 10 episode of the show, Cartwright met with a divorce lawyer and said she was "terrified" she was going to allow Taylor "to slowly make his way back into my life." "I need to go ahead and rip the Band-Aid off, get this process started and never look back," she said. "I know deep down this is the right next step." In the June 17 episode of the show, Taylor said during a confessional that being served divorce papers upon his return from the facility was "f------ hard." "Imagine coming out of a facility, dealing with your mental health issues and then being slammed with divorce papers," he said. "And then, on top of it, it going public before you've even had the time to digest it. It's hard." "Getting those divorce papers, it's devastating," he continued. "We're both so hurt. We both hurt each other so much in the last couple of years. We don't have anything left." Along with Taylor and Cartwright, The Valley also stars Kristen Doute, Luke Broderick, Jesse Lally, Michelle Saniei, Daniel Booko, Nia Sanchez, Jasmine Goode, Zack Wickham and Janet and Jason Caperna. The season 2 finale of The Valley airs Tuesday, July 22, at 8 p.m. ET on Bravo. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment TV Reality TV

Brianna “Chickenfry” LaPaglia is dropping hints about season 4 of Special Forces, and it appears there’s going to be some drama between her and Sister Wives star Kody Brown.
Chickenfry, 26, and Brown, 56, were both announced as part of the cast on Wednesday, August 6. The Barstool Sports personality took to Instagram that same day to answer fan questions, and one user asked if it was awkward filming with Brown.
“Let’s just say I didn’t know who he was while filming,” she wrote via her Instagram Story. “And we didn’t necessarily ~get along well~ lmao you will see.”
Special Forces: World’s Toughest Test puts celebrity contestants through grueling challenges that real United States Special Forces hopefuls must complete if they want to join the military. (Previous winners include season 1’s Hannah Brown and Carli Lloyd, season 2’s Nick Viall, Tyler Cameron and Erin Jackson and season 3’s Kayla Nicole and Brody Jenner.)
Brown is stepping out of the Sister Wives shadow to take on the challenge just months after saying his ex-wives, Meri Brown, Janelle Brown and Christine Brown, have painted him as a villain on the TLC reality hit. He has been married to fourth wife Robyn Brown since 2014.
“It’s not about being the villain,” he said in a May episode of Sister Wives: One-on-One. “It’s about being villainized.”
“My mouth runs fluidly. It’s easy to make fun of somebody who doesn’t have a filter.” he continued. “It’s hard to be accountable for things that you’re saying in a passionate moment.”
As for Chickenfry, her appearance on Special Forces comes amid a feud with ex-boyfriend Zach Bryan. Bryan, 29, posted a video of a Barstool Sports “Saturdays are for the Boys” flag on fire via his Instagram Story on Monday, August 4 as an apparent swipe at his ex, as Tyler Childers’ song “Bitin’ List” played in the background.
Chickenfry appeared to respond on Monday by posting “Nurse, he’s loose again” to her story.
During her Q&A on Wednesday, Chickenfry spoke more about her emotions while filming Special Forces, saying she cried “every day” and that viewers will see her experience “panic attack after panic attack.” It appeared, however, that she found the experience worthwhile, saying she learned “so much.”
“I learned how mentally strong I am and I now have such a deepened respect and love for our special forces military,” she wrote. “The things they sacrifice so we can sit on our couches at home are unfathomable.”
Special Forces season 4 premieres on Fox Thursday, September 25, at 9 p.m. ET.

Jussie Smollett, Kody Brown and Teresa Giudice Among Stars to Be Put to the Test on Special Forces Season 4 Recruits will head to Morocco, where they "must learn the art of getting comfortable with being uncomfortable as they are faced with training challenges across the country’s expansive desert terrain" By Stephanie Wenger Stephanie Wenger Stephanie Wenger is a TV Writer/Reporter at PEOPLE. She joined the brand in 2021 as a digital news writer, covering stories spanning across the site's verticals. She previously contributed E! Online, Hollywood Life and Oscar.com. People Editorial Guidelines Published on August 6, 2025 05:00PM EDT 7 Comments From left: Kody Brown, Teresa Giudice, Jussie Smollett on 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test'. Credit : Pete Dadds/FOX NEED TO KNOW Jussie Smollett, Kody Brown and Teresa Giudice are among stars to be put to the test on Special Forces: World's Toughest Test season 4Fox announced all 18 stars — including two celebrity couples — who are set to become recruits on the upcoming seasonBrody Jenner and Kayla Nicole won the show's last season Jussie Smollett, Kody Brown and Teresa Giudice are gearing up for some fierce competition on Special Forces: World's Toughest Test season 4. On Wednesday, Aug. 6, Fox announced that the Empire alum, 43, the Sister Wives star, 56, and the Real Housewives of New Jersey star, 53, are among the recruits who will be pushing themselves to the limit on the competition series. Teresa will be facing off with her own daughter, Gia Giudice, who currently stars on Next Gen NYC. Our new app is here! Free, fun and full of exclusives. Scan to download now! From left: Shawn Johnson East and Andrew East on 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test'. Pete Dadds/FOX The mother-daughter duo are not the only competitors with family ties. Olympic gymnast Shawn Johnson East and her husband, Andrew East, a former NFL long snapper, will go head-to-head, as well as singer and actress Jessie James Decker and her husband, Eric Decker, a former NFL wide receiver. Andrew and Eric will be joined by fellow NFL alums Randall Cobb and Johnny Manziel. Other athletes in the competition include Olympic soccer player Christie Pearce Rampone and retired NBA player Nick Young. The Valley star Brittany Cartwright, Montana Boyz TikToker Mark Estes, model Chanel Iman, influencer Brianna LaPaglia, Real Housewives of Atlanta alum Eva Marcille and actor Ravi V. Patel round out the cast. Related Stories 'Special Forces' Season 3 Comes to an End After Recruits Are Pushed to Their Breaking Point in Final Challenge: See Who Won Trista Sutter Recalls Hitting a 'Breaking Point' on 'Special Forces' as the World 'Lost Its Mind' Over Ryan’s Cryptic Posts (Exclusive) In season 5, the recruits will be training in Morocco and “will endure the extreme circumstances of urban warfare,” according to a press release. “New this season, some recruits will arrive in pairs consisting of spouses and family members, but will compete individually,” the description continues. “All recruits must learn the art of getting comfortable with being uncomfortable as they are faced with training challenges across the country’s expansive desert terrain.”The challenges — under the direction of Directing Staff (DS) agents Rudy Reyes, Mark “Billy” Billingham, Jason “Foxy” Fox and Jovon “Q” Quarles — are set to include “a supply search in an abandoned village where they must race to extraction, a treacherous rat-run through dark and narrow tunnels, a plane shell dunk drill where pairs of recruits will be submerged underwater and must escape, a death-defying urban ladder crossing between buildings 50 ft above the urban streets, and much more.” While there are “no votes and no eliminations – just survival,” the competitors, “who are so used to being in the spotlight, will quickly learn the meaning of ‘no guts, no glory’ – and no glam.” As you will recall, Brody Jenner and Kayla Nicole won season 3 after an intense series of challenges. Keep reading to see the entire cast of Special Forces: World's Toughest Test season 4, which premieres on Thursday, Sept. 25 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on Fox. The Sister Wives Family: A Guide to the Reality Stars' Former Plural Marriage and 18 Children Kody Brown has 18 children from his four marriages to Meri, Janelle, Christine and Robyn By Karli Bendlin Karli Bendlin Karli Bendlin is the Director of Content Strategy at PEOPLE. She has over nine years of editorial experience covering entertainment, beauty, and lifestyle, and has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. People Editorial Guidelines and Nicole Pomarico Published on April 20, 2025 08:00AM EDT Leave a Comment Janelle Brown, Christine Brown, Kody Brown, Meri Brown and Robyn Brown. Credit : Joe Pugliese / © TLC / Courtesy Everett Collection A lot has changed since TLC's hit series Sister Wives introduced fans to Kody Brown and his plural family for the first time in 2010. Now that the reality show is in its 19th season, with its midseason premiering on April 20, there have been a lot of ups and downs for Kody, his four wives and 18 children. When the series premiered in 2010, Kody was legally married to his first wife, Meri Brown, and "spiritually married" to his two other wives, Janelle Brown and Christine Brown. However, viewers were quickly introduced to Kody's fourth wife, Robyn Brown, whom he spiritually married in 2010 and later legally married in 2014 after first divorcing Meri. The group faced obstacles — including a shocking catfishing scandal involving Meri in 2016 and a move from Las Vegas to Flagstaff, Ariz. in 2018 — that were captured by TLC cameras, but there were plenty of moments of joy as well as their children grew up and started families of their own. Where Are the Sister Wives Now? A Look at Their Lives After 19 Seasons of the TLC Series — and Where They Stand with Kody Today In November 2021, Kody and Christine announced their split after more than 25 years of marriage. A little over a year later, Kody and Janelle officially confirmed they were separated in December 2022. And just a few days after the news of Kody and Janelle's news, PEOPLE confirmed that Kody's 32-year marriage with his first wife Meri was also over. From where his four marriages stand today to his 18 children, here's everything to know about Kody Brown and his plural family. Kody and Meri Brown Kody Brown and Meri Brown. Ida Mae Astute/Walt Disney Television via Getty Images After growing up in a polygamous family of her own (she's one of 25 siblings), Meri first met Kody in 1989 and married him the following year. Though Meri was Kody's only legal wife for many years, the pair divorced in 2014 so that he could legally marry his new wife, Robyn, while he and Meri remained spiritually married. At the time, the Browns said in a statement that they had chosen to "legally restructure" their family and that the decision was made as a unit. However, the choice was still an emotional one for Meri, as she explained in a 2015 Sister Wives Tell All special. In 2016, Meri become embroiled in a catfishing scandal after she entered into an online relationship with a person she thought was another man, but was later revealed to be a woman. Though Kody and Meri started therapy to deal with the emotional fallout from the situation, their relationship became more platonic than romantic in the aftermath. In April 2021, Meri explained on Sister Wives that she and Kody were "celebrating our non-anniversary, 'cause we're not a couple, but we're in a family." The pair's relationship seemingly hit a breaking point in December 2022, and Meri announced that her marriage to Kody was over. In January 2024, Meri introduced fans to her boyfriend, Amos, whom she had been dating since October 2023. Just over a month after Meri shared her new relationship with the world, she announced that they had gone their separate ways in an Instagram post, admitting that "a life long relationship isn't in the cards" for her and Amos. Kody and Meri Brown's Kid Leon Brown, 29 Audrey Kriss and Leon Brown pose for a photo together. Leon Brown/ Instagram After five years of marriage, the pair welcomed their child, Leon Brown, in July 1995. Meri would later suffer a miscarriage in 2008. She spoke candidly about the loss on Instagram more than a decade later. "I don't know for sure that my baby was even a boy, but my gut tells me it was. He'd be 15 now, and I often wonder what life would be like with him here," Meri wrote on Instagram. Although she was raised in polygamy and was part of a plural marriage herself, Meri tried to create a different culture for Leon, who came out as transgender and queer in June 2022. In July 2022, Meri celebrated Leon turning 27 with a touching tribute on Instagram. "Happiest of birthdays to my miracle, my always amazing, Leo the Lion," she wrote, in part. "Know you are forever loved by me @leointhemountains," she continued, "and I am honored and blessed to be your mom! I love you!!" Leon quietly married their partner, Audrey Kriss, in October 2022. Kody and Janelle Brown Janelle and Kody Brown. Gabe Ginsberg/FilmMagic Three years after Kody and Meri wed, their family officially became plural when Kody "spiritually married" Janelle. Kody and Janelle went on to welcome six children together: sons Logan, Hunter, Garrison and Gabriel as well as daughters Madison and Savanah. Kody and Janelle's relationship made headlines in 2021 after she revealed she was living in an RV parked on the Browns' Coyote Pass property in Flagstaff, Ariz. She later explained that she was having doubts about whether plural marriage was still for her. Though Meri said she felt "betrayed" by Christine's decision to leave the family, Janelle was "supportive from the get-go," as Christine told PEOPLE in August 2022. "Janelle and I have stayed close through the whole thing," she explained. "She's wonderful." Janelle's reaction to Christine's departure from the plural family was perhaps foreshadowing her own decision to leave, which Kody confirmed in December 2022. "I am separated from Janelle," he said in a sneak peek for Sister Wives: One on One. "And I'm divorced from Christine [Brown]." Janelle Brown's Kids: All About Her Family with Sister Wives Costar and Ex-Husband Kody Brown Just one day after her split from Kody was announced, Janelle shared an optimistic note on Instagram, writing that she's looking forward to health and happiness in the new year. "I'm ready for you 2023!" she captioned a video chronicling her progress on her "health journey." In 2024, Janelle relocated to Raleigh, N.C., with her daughter Madison and her family to open Taeda Farms. Kody and Janelle Brown's Kids Logan Brown, 30 Janelle and Logan Brown. Janelle Brown/Instagram Janelle and Kody welcomed their first child, son Logan, on May 21, 1994. After growing up in Utah, he moved with his family to Nevada, where he enrolled in the University of Nevada, Las Vegas and obtained a bachelor's degree in kinesiology and exercise science. He currently works as the director of strategic operations at TravelWealth, according to his LinkedIn. In September 2017, Logan announced his engagement to his girlfriend of three years, Michelle Petty. The couple said "I do" in October 2022 in Arizona. Madison Brush, 29 Madison Brush. Madison Brush Instagram The couple's second child and first daughter, Madison — who goes by Maddie — was born on Nov. 3, 1995. Maddie attended Utah State University after high school, but later dropped out after getting engaged to her boyfriend Caleb Brush, whom she married in June 2016. The pair welcomed their first child, son Axel James, in May 2017, followed by their daughter Evangalynn Kodi, whom they welcomed in August 2019. Before Evangalynn was born, she was diagnosed with oligodactyly, a congenital anomaly defined as the presence of fewer than five fingers on a hand. When she was born, she was also missing a thumb and a toe, and one leg was missing a fibula. She also had a bowed tibia (shinbone) and two of her fingers were fused together. Evangalynn was later diagnosed with fibular aplasia, tibial campomelia and oligosyndactyly (FATCO) syndrome, an extremely rare genetic disorder that affects bone formation in utero. In August 2020, Maddie shared that Evangalynn had her foot amputated but had returned home from the hospital and was "recovering beautifully." On Feb. 10, 2023, Maddie gave birth to her second daughter. The next day, the reality star posted a photo of the newborn in a pink onesie. "Welcome to the world Josephine Lee Brush!💚" she wrote on Instagram. The couple's fourth child, a baby girl named Emilia Estelle, arrived in March 2025. Just before adding another baby to the family, Maddie and Caleb made the move to N.C. to open Taeda Farms with Janelle. Hunter Brown, 28 Hunter Brown. Janelle Brown Instagram Two years after welcoming Maddie, Janelle gave birth to her and Kody's third child, son Hunter, on Feb. 9, 1997. After growing up in his plural family, Hunter enrolled at the United States Air Force Academy, graduating in April 2020. He later moved to Baltimore to attend nursing school, announcing he had obtained his master's degree from the Johns Hopkins School of Nursing in May 2022. In July 2022, Janelle revealed that Hunter had returned to Arizona to live near his family. "This mommas heart is bursting ❤️," Janelle captioned a selfie of the two. "My son Hunter is 'local-ish' for the first time in 7 years." Garrison Brown Garrison Brown. Janelle Brown Instagram Janelle and Kody's fourth child, son Garrison, was born on April 10, 1998. Garrison died by suicide in March 2024. He was 25. "Kody and I are deeply saddened to announce the loss of our beautiful boy Robert Garrison Brown. He was a bright spot in the lives of all who knew him," Janelle wrote in a statement on Instagram. "Our loss will leave such a big hole in our lives, that it takes our breath away." Gabriel Brown, 23 Gabriel Brown. Janelle Brown Instagram The pair welcomed their fifth child, son Gabriel, who goes by Gabe, on Oct. 11, 2001. In a December 2022 episode of Sister Wives, Gabe got emotional during a confessional as he recalled when Kody forgot his birthday during a phone call they had in October. "I shouldn't have done this but I did anyway — I didn't remind him that it was my birthday because I wanted to see if he remembered. And he didn't," Gabe said before breaking down in tears. "A couple hours after that he tried to call me back and tell me happy birthday and make up for it. And that's the last time I ever talked to my dad," he added. For her part, Janelle celebrated her youngest son's 21st birthday with a sweet Instagram post. "My Gabe is 21! Where does the time go!" she captioned the post. Savanah Brown, 20 Savanah Brown. Janelle Brown Instagram Janelle and Kody's sixth and youngest kid, Savanah, was born on Dec. 7, 2004. She is very close with her mom, and Janelle regularly shares photos on Instagram of the two during their mother-daughter excursions. Savanah also regularly spends time with her larger blended family, including her half-sister Truely, the daughter of Kody and Christine. Kody and Christine Brown Kody Brown and Christine Brown. Christine Brown/INSTAGRAM Kody met Christine in 1990, though the pair didn't go on their first date until Valentine's Day in 1994. The following month, they entered a spiritual marriage and Christine became the third wife to join their polygamous family. After their union, Kody and Christine welcomed six children of their own: daughters Aspyn, Mykelti, Gwendlyn, Ysabel, Truely and son Paedon. Christine became the first of Kody's wives to leave the plural family in November 2021, a decision she later revealed was partially the result of Kody's relationship with their children. During a December 2022 appearance on the Reality Life with Kate Casey podcast, Christine explained that their kids were disappointed with Kody for years after he allegedly failed to spend meaningful time with them. While Christine and Kody's split initially appeared amicable, with Christine saying in a statement that the former couple "will continue to be a strong presence in each other's lives," Kody later revealed in an episode of Sister Wives that his feelings differed. Christine, however, appears to be focused on the future. On Feb. 7, 2023, over a year since her split from Kody, she revealed that she was "exclusively" dating someone, later revealed to be Utah grandfather, David Woolley. "He's wonderful and romantic and so kind, and everything I've been looking for," Christine said in her Instagram Story. The following month, the mother of six revealed that she and Woolley were engaged. "David treats me like a queen and tells me I'm beautiful everyday," Christine told PEOPLE. "I've never been in love like this before and the world seems like a brighter place with him in it." The reality star added that he's "incredible" with her youngest daughter, Truley. Christine married Woolley in October 2023. Just before their wedding, she told PEOPLE that, despite her split from the family, she doesn't regret the life she and her former sister wives built with Kody. “Just because I left, it doesn’t mean we failed,” Christine said, adding, "Our goal was to raise incredible children, and we did. It was a success for us.” Kody and Christine Brown's Kids Aspyn Brown, 30 Aspyn Brown and Christine Brown. Christine Brown Instagram Christine and Kody welcomed their first daughter, Aspyn, on March 14, 1995. Like her half-brother Logan, Aspyn later attended the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. After announcing her engagement to boyfriend Mitch Thompson in January 2018, the pair tied the knot that June in front of 120 guests. As a nod to Thompson's Scottish heritage, his mother made hats for Aspyn's mom Christine as well as her three sister wives, Meri, Janelle and Robyn. In March 2023, Christine helped celebrate her oldest's 28th birthday by dressing up for high tea. Mitch, Ysabel and Mykelti also joined the festivities at The Grand American Hotel in Salt Lake City, Utah. The proud mom posted photos and a video from the outing, including a photo of the group smiling at their table. "Had a lovely time during High Tea to celebrate Aspyn's birthday," Christine wrote in the caption. "She's such an amazing strong and independent woman. I'm so proud of everything she's accomplished. I love sharing in her life moments." Mykelti Brown, 28 Mykelti Brown. Mykelti Padron Instagram Christine gave birth to her and Kody's second daughter, Mykelti, on June 9, 1996. She became the third Brown child to enroll at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, following her half-brother Logan and her sister Aspyn. In 2016, Mykelti married Antonio Padron in front of 400 guests — including all 23 members of her blended family. Mykelti and Padron welcomed their first child, daughter Avalon Asa, in April 2021, making Christine a grandmother for the first time. In November 2022, the couple expanded their family again with the addition of their twin sons, Archer Banks and Ace McCord. In January 2023, Mykelti weighed in on the Sister Wives drama, sharing her opinion on the end of her father's marriage with Meri. Paedon Brown, 26 Paedon Brown. Paedon Brown Instagram Christine and Kody's third child and only son together, Paedon, was born on Aug. 7, 1998. After high school, he joined the National Guard, as Christine announced on Instagram in 2019. Like his half-brothers Garrison and Gabe, Paedon seemingly disagreed with his father Kody's strict rules during the COVID-19 pandemic. In February 2022, he posted a TikTok that appeared to throw shade at Kody's wife Robyn. In the video, he wore a shirt that said "What. Does. The Nanny. Do?" seemingly referencing an earlier comment from his mom Christine, who questioned why Robyn was able to hire a nanny during the pandemic when Kody's protocols prevented the family from seeing each other frequently. Gwendlyn Brown, 23 Gwendlyn Brown. Gwendlyn Brown Instagram Christine welcomed her fourth child, daughter Gwendlyn, on Oct. 15, 2001. In December 2022, she announced her engagement to her girlfriend of almost nine months, Beatriz Queiroz. The couple wed in July 2023 during an intimate ceremony in Flagstaff, Ariz. In an episode of Sister Wives, Christine shared that after Meri's child Leon came out as transgender, she realized that Gwendlyn identified as LGBTQ+. "When [Leon] told us [they were] gay. Immediately I thought oh so is Gwendlyn. I knew immediately," Christine said. "We've had just great conversations about it." Gwendlyn spoke about her relationship with her father in a YouTube video posted on Dec. 31, 2022. "It's very flip-floppy for me. In person, my dad's sweet to me now," she said. The Sister Wives star, 53, paid tribute to her mother Bonnie Ahlstrom on the third anniversary of her death, and marked the 3-week anniversary of Garrison’s death, on Instagram Tuesday. “Today, March 26, marks 3 years since the passing of my beautiful mom, and 3 weeks since the passing of our sweet Garrison,” she wrote alongside a split image of her with both of her loved ones. Sister Wives' Christine Brown Is Focusing on 'Work' in Order to 'Keep Moving Forward' After Garrison's Death The reality star then reflected on how grief can bring about “a myriad of emotions,” including “despair and anger, feelings of pain, or hopelessness.” She added, “It's a universal human emotion and a natural response to loss.” “Grief is also love, for without feeling the love, the pain of loss wouldn't be so great,” she continued. “Grief sends you on a roller coaster of emotions, never knowing the twists and turns ahead, whether you're headed into an upturn or a free fall.” “Grief is not linear. There's no timeline or rulebook to follow. It's not the same for any two people, and no two people handle it in the same exact way.” Meri Brown with her mother and Garrison Brown. I recognize when I need to surround myself with my trusted people to gather strength from them. I recognize when I need to attempt, in some small way, a semblance of normalcy. In each step, it takes a little bit of bravery to recognize and give that gift to myself.” Meri added: “My timeline of grief, the way I deal with it, the emotions I feel through it, might be different than yours, and yours may be different than the next person's. Jussie Smollett Speaks Out After Reaching Settlement with City of Chicago, Paying $50K to Charity: 'Onward' The former 'Empire' actor, who claimed he was the victim of a hate crime in 2019, also said he's made an additional $10,000 donation to a separate charity By Carson Blackwelder Carson Blackwelder Carson Blackwelder is a TV Writer/Editor at PEOPLE. His work has previously appeared on Good Morning America/ABC News Digital and Closer Weekly. People Editorial Guidelines Published on May 23, 2025 04:48PM EDT 32 Comments Jussie Smollett. Credit : Shane Anthony Sinclair/Getty NEED TO KNOW Jussie Smollett is speaking out after agreeing to make a $50,000 charitable donation to settle a civil lawsuit with the city of ChicagoThe lawsuit stemmed from Smollett's allegations he was the victim of a hate crime in 2019In a statement he shared to Instagram, the former Empire actor said he's made an additional $10,000 donation and is looking "onward" Jussie Smollett has agreed to pay a $50,000 charitable donation to settle a years-long legal saga with the city of Chicago, stemming from his allegations he was the victim of a hate crime in 2019. The former Empire star shared a lengthy statement to Instagram on Friday, May 23, explaining how this resolution came to be, why he chose the charity he donated to and his thoughts on his future now that this chapter is behind him. "Over six years ago, after it was reported I had been jumped, City Officials in Chicago set out to convince the public that I willfully set an assault against myself. This false narrative has left a stain on my character that will not soon disappear," he began. "These officials wanted my money and wanted my confession for something I did not do. Today, it should be clear….They have received neither." Smollett went on to say the decision to settle the civil lawsuit with the city "was not the most difficult one to make." "After repeatedly refusing to pay the City, I was presented with an opportunity to make a charitable donation in exchange for the case being dismissed," he continued. "Despite what happened there politically, Chicago was my home for over 5 years and the people became my family. Therefore, making a donation to benefit Chicago communities that are too often neglected by those in power will always be something I support." Smollett then announced he'd made a $50,000 donation to Building Brighter Futures Center for the Arts, which he described as "a local nonprofit doing incredible work nurturing self expression, creativity and exploration of the arts for Chicago youth." "This organization was of my choosing and I'm comforted that there will be at least one winner from this experience," he added. Though the convictions against him were overturned by the Illinois Supreme Court in November 2024 and the city's civil case against him will now be dismissed, Smollett said he's "aware that it will not change everyone's mind about me or the attack I experienced." Jussie Smollett (Center) and the actor's attorney Tina Glandian (L) in Leighton Criminal Court Building in Chicago in March 2019. E. Jason Wambsgans-Pool/Getty "However, despite arduous and expensive attempts to punish me, I am innocent in the eyes of God and our criminal justice system. What I have to do now is move forward," he continued. "I will continue creating my art, fighting passionately for causes I hold dear and defending my integrity and family name with the truth." Smollett then said he was "grateful to have had the resources to defend myself" and acknowledged that "many do not." "They are backed into corners to take deals or confess to crimes they did not actually commit," he explained. "In their honor, I am donating an additional $10,000.00 to the Chicago Torture Justice Center who provides resources to communities healing from the violence and the Chicago Police Department. To anyone who has had to prove they have in fact been violated, you know how difficult this can be to navigate. I stand with and for you." Related Stories Jussie Smollett on 'The Lost Holliday' and How He Wouldn't 'Be Here' Without Friends Like Taraji P. Henson (Exclusive) Attorney Claims Jussie Smollett Was Victim of 'Vindictive Persecution' After Conviction Is Overturned (Exclusive) Smollett ended his post with a message of thanks to those who supported him throughout the years. "Your prayers and belief in me mean more than words can properly express. I will never take it lightly and will never forget," he concluded. "Onward." More than six years ago, Smollett, who identifies as a gay Black man, claimed that on Jan. 29, 2019, he was the victim of a hate crime. He alleged he was attacked by two men late at night on his way to his home in Chicago, claiming the men yelled racist and homophobic slurs at him, put a noose around his neck and doused him with bleach. Jussie Smollett (Center) after being released from the Cook County Department of Corrections detention center in March 2022. Scott Olson/Getty Following an investigation conducted by law enforcement, prosecutors alleged that Smollett staged the attack to get media attention and paid two brothers, Abimbola "Bola" and Olabinjo "Ola" Osundairo, to help him pull it off. Smollett was found guilty of five felony counts of disorderly conduct for filing false police reports following a jury trial in 2021. He was sentenced to 150 days in jail in March 2022 as well as hit with a $25,000 fine and ordered to pay more than $120,000 in restitution to the Chicago Police Department. He served six days of his sentence before he was released on bail. Smollett has maintained his innocence over the years, opening up to PEOPLE in September 2024 — about a month before the Supreme Court of Illinios overturned his conviction — about how he was dealing with being at the center of the high-profile case. "People can say what they want about you, but they have no control," he said at the time. "They can do whatever they want, they can even put you behind bars. They can control your physical, but they can't control my mind. They can't control my spirit. They can't control my soul, and they can't control the knowledge that I have of who I am." Special Forces Season 4: What We Know About the Intense Reality Show's Next Chapter 'Special Forces' season 4 will premiere on Fox on Sept. 25 By Caroline Blair Caroline Blair Caroline Blair is a writer for PEOPLE. She has been writing about celebrities, entertainment, reality TV stars and news for five years. People Editorial Guidelines Published on August 7, 2025 11:45AM EDT 2 Comments Teresa Giudice, Gia Giudice and Jussie Smollett on 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test'. Credit : PETE DADDS/FOX (3) NEED TO KNOW Special Forces: World's Toughest Test is returning to television screens for another seasonSeason 4 of Special Forces premieres Sept. 25The hit Fox competition show announced the official cast and a slight twist in August Another group of contestants is undergoing the toughest test! Special Forces: World's Toughest Test is returning for a fourth season with a new cast. The Fox show follows a group of celebrities who are shipped off to a foreign country and participate in various challenges that mimic military training. In past seasons, the show featured celebrities who may or may not have known each other before. However, Special Forces switched things up for season 4 and cast a few pairs that enter as families but competed individually. Season 4 takes place in Morocco, where contestants "must learn the art of getting comfortable with being uncomfortable," per the show's description. Season 4 will star Teresa Giudice and Gia Giudice, Jussie Smollett, Eva Marcille and Brittany Cartwright, among others. Here's everything to know about season 4 of Special Forces: World's Toughest Test, including the cast, premiere date and premise. What is Special Forces about? Season 3 premiere of 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test.'. Pete Dadds/FOX Special Forces: World's Toughest Test is one of the most physically strenuous reality competition shows. In the Fox series, over a dozen celebrities, reality TV stars and athletes volunteer to be shipped away to a foreign country and participate in rigorous, psychological and daunting challenges. Different from other competition shows, in Special Forces, the goal is for celebrities to pass tasks, rather than compete against one another to win. The main way that someone leaves the show is by volunteering to, but they may also be forced to leave due to injury or at the request of one of the directing staff members. The celebrities work with former special forces operatives Rudy Reyes, Mark “Billy” Billingham, Jason “Foxy” Fox and Jovon “Q” Quarles. While they push themselves to the furthest physical extent, the agents also challenge contestants to take the time to dig deep both mentally and emotionally. "Viewers see the recruits face the harshest of environments that simulate the highly classified selection process, pushing themselves in the ultimate test of their physical, mental and emotional resilience and revealing the celebrities' deepest and truest character," the show's synopsis reads. While every season is different depending on the location, some of the past challenges have included walking across a tightrope over a cliff, rescuing themselves from a sinking car and invading a crate filled with poisonous gases and chemicals. Is there a trailer for Special Forces season 4? Brittany Cartwright in 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test.'. PETE DADDS/FOX There is no trailer for Special Forces season 4 as of early August. However, several of the cast members shared a teaser video that introduced the cast and read, "Special Forces: World's Toughest Test Season 4: The New Recruits." When does season 4 of Special Forces come out? Kody Brown in 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test.'. PETE DADDS/FOX Special Forces: World's Toughest Test season 4 premieres on Thursday, Sept. 25 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on Fox. Who is in the cast of Special Forces season 4? Brianna LaPaglia, Shawn Johnson East, Eva Marcille. Season 4 of Special Forces will feature 18 celebrities, reality television stars and athletes. However, unlike past seasons, season 4 consists of people arriving by themselves, as well as with a partner or family member. “New this season, some recruits will arrive in pairs consisting of spouses and family members, but will compete individually,” the description reads. The contestants who arrived as pairs include The Real Housewives of New Jersey star Teresa Giudice and her daughter, Gia Giudice; Olympic gymnast Shawn Johnson East and her husband, former NFL athlete Andrew East; and singer Jessie James Decker and her husband, former NFL athlete Eric Decker. In addition to the six celebrities who came in duos, the cast also includes Sister Wives star Kody Brown, Empire alum Jussie Smollett, The Valley star Brittany Cartwright, The Real Housewives of Atlanta alum Eva Marcille, influencer and podcast host Brianna LaPaglia, model Chanel Iman, Transformers actor Ravi V. Patel and Montana Boyz TikToker Mark Estes. The cast is rounded out by a slew of former athletes, including NFL alums Randall Cobb and Johnny Manziel, Olympic soccer player Christie Pearce Rampone and former NBA athlete Nick Young. Past contestants of Special Forces have included Brody Jenner, Hannah Brown, Tom Sandoval, Dwight Howard, JoJo Siwa, Tyler Cameron, Kayla Nicole, Cam Newton and Denise Richards, among others. Where was season 4 of Special Forces filmed? Nastia Liukin, Mel B and Dwight Howard in 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test.'. Pete Dadds/FOX The fourth season of Special Forces took contestants to Morocco to "endure the extreme circumstances of urban warfare," per the season's description. "All recruits must learn the art of getting comfortable with being uncomfortable as they are faced with training challenges across the country’s expansive desert terrain, including a supply search in an abandoned village where they must race to extraction, a treacherous rat-run through dark and narrow tunnels, a plane shell dunk drill where pairs of recruits will be submerged underwater and must escape, a death-defying urban ladder crossing between buildings 50 ft above the urban streets, and much more," the show teased. The past three seasons have taken place in different countries across the world — including Jordan, New Zealand and Wales. Where can I watch past seasons of Special Forces? Denise Richards in 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test.'. Pete Dadds/FOX While the current season of Special Forces: World's Toughest Test will air on Fox, all episodes will be available on Hulu the next day. Viewers can catch up by watching the first three seasons on Hulu, Disney+ or through purchases on Apple TV or Prime Video. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment TV Reality TV

She announced their engagement in an Instagram post on Christmas in 2020, showing off her sparkling ring — but it wouldn't be long until she'd be given an upgrade. "My husband is all about making sure I'm that girl," she shared of her new ring from Cunningham in the season 16 premiere. "I went from seven-and-a-half carats, and now, I have a 10-carat solitaire." After the two got married in a low-key wedding during the pandemic, Eady shared a sweet Instagram message to her husband in October 2021, writing, "I prayed for the life I have and I have the best hubby that literally gives me any and everything in this world. He always gets it right, down to the smallest things." 03 of 09 Angela Oakley and Charles Oakley Angela Oakley and Charles Oakley attend Bravo's 'The Real Housewives Of Atlanta' season 16 premiere on March 7, 2025, in Atlanta. Paras Griffin/Getty Angela Oakley has been married to her husband — former NBA player Charles Oakley — since 2016. Angela has called Charles her "best friend," while the basketball legend has shared his support for his wife's new Bravo gig. In February 2025, Charles shared her cast photo on Instagram, writing, "Congratulations, @angelaoakley34 you have my love and support." During an interview with Entertainment Tonight ahead of the show's premiere, Angela got candid about what her husband really thinks of their life being put on display for RHOA, saying, "Charles is not afraid of a camera." "It's lights, camera, action. Charles is showing up," she said. "We're very private, so I think initially, we were like, 'Oh my god.' But then, you forget the cameras are there and you just live your life." Angela and Charles have a blended family of four children. 04 of 09 Shamea Morton and Gerald Mwangi Shamea Morton Mwangi and Gerald Mwangi attend Bravo's 'The Real Housewives Of Atlanta' season 16 premiere on March 7, 2025, in Atlanta. Paras Griffin/Getty Before marrying in July 2017, Shamea Morton met her husband Gerald Mwangi in October 2014, when he bought her a drink at the Rose Bar nightclub in Atlanta. The pair were just friends at first but reconnected later during a cookout at his house. “I’m like, ‘He gotta have a lot of baggage cause ain't nobody letting this good man just walk around Atlanta,' " she shared during the season 16 premiere of RHOA. "But ... we had the best time." Morton explained that Mwangi asked her on a date the next day, despite the fact that she "blew up his bathroom" after the cookout. "Hallelujah, thank you Jesus, this man accepted me for me and all of everything I did to that man’s bathroom," Morton joked. "And we ain’t parted ways since." Morton and Mwangi now live in a $9 million mansion, where they raise their two daughters: Shya and Shiloh. 05 of 09 Cynthia Bailey and LePrince Cynthia Bailey and her boyfriend, LePrince. Courtesy Cynthia Bailey Cynthia Bailey, who appears as a friend in RHOA, told PEOPLE in March 2025 that she has been dating a new man — Amsterdam musician LePrince — for "nearly a year." “We've chosen to keep our relationship off social media to focus on each other without outside distractions,” she said. Bailey added, “We've traveled a lot together, including my trips to Amsterdam and Switzerland to see him perform. We're happy and excited to see where our relationship goes!” The Bravo alum was previously married to Mike Hill, whom she divorced in December 2022. 06 of 09 Kenya Moore Kenya Moore attends her hair spa grand opening at Kenya Moore Hair Spa on June 6, 2024, in Atlanta. Prince Williams/WireImage Kenya Moore was married to Marc Daly from June 2017 until their separation in September 2019. They welcomed their only daughter, Brooklyn Doris, on Nov. 4, 2018. All About Kenya Moore's Daughter Brooklyn When her divorce was finalized in December 2023, Moore told PEOPLE she was "excited for this next chapter in my life." "As a hopeless romantic, I still believe my forever person exists and know I’ll have my happily ever after ending after all," she continued. Moore was then linked to a new beau, Roi Shlomo, who she called "a keeper" during season 15 of RHOA, which debuted in May 2023. "I’m kind of crazy about him," she said during the first episode. "He’s been very kind to me. He’s funny. He makes me feel alive. And he’s not bad on the eyes.” 07 of 09 Porsha Williams Porsha Williams. Charles Sykes/Bravo via Getty When Porsha Williams first joined the Bravo reality show in 2012, she was married to former NFL star, Kordell Stewart, whom she divorced in 2013. She went on to get engaged to Dennis McKinley in 2018, and they welcomed one daughter — Pilar Jhena — on March 22, 2019, before going their separate ways just months later. The Bravo star then married Simon Guobadia in November 2022 and filed for divorce in February 2024. More recently, the TV personality appeared on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen in March 2025 and said she was "not really comfortable" dating right now. "I did try, trust me. I went on a date, well a few. It just was like, 'I don't really give a F what you're talking about,' " Williams said. "So, I have to get to the space where I want to get to know someone, 'cause I really don't want to get to know people right now in that way." 08 of 09 Drew Sidora Drew Sidora attends a screening of Tubi's 'Vicious Murder' at LOOK Dine-In Cinemas Glendale on Oct. 11, 2024, in Glendale, Calif. Paul Archuleta/Getty After eight years of marriage, Drew Sidora split from her husband Ralph Pittman in February 2023. Weeks later, they each filed for divorce. In July 2024, Sidora told PEOPLE that their divorce was "still not settled" and that they were "still living together under the same roof." "I didn't even know that could happen. I was like, 'What?' But yeah — he is living in the basement, and that was court-ordered," she said. "It'd be much easier if we were able to move on separately; you know, out of sight, out of mind, with your own space and your own energy. But that's clearly not in the cards." The RHOA star welcomed two kids with Pittman — Machai and Aniya — and has one child, Josiah, from a previous relationship. She has since sparked dating rumors with Williams' ex-fiancé McKinley, which comes up as a storyline throughout season 16 of RHOA. 09 of 09 Kelli Ferrell Kelli Ferrell attends Gucci Mane The Road To 1017 Featuring The Atlanta Pops Orchestra on Oct. 12, 2024, in Atlanta. Prince Williams/WireImage Newcomer Kelli Ferrell is still in the process of divorcing her ex, Chuvalo Mark Ferrell, to whom she was married for 11 years. In the season 16 premiere, Kelli opened up about the "long two and a half years" it's been as they've been working to finalize their divorce. "It’s definitely been hard, I have to say ... I got married, I had children, I created a business and all of those amazing things," she said. "So how do we turn from that to complete enemies?" Kelli also expressed being ready for the next chapter of her life, saying, "I just want to cut that phase of my life completely out and take my name back." She is a mom to four daughters, three of which she shares with Chuvalo. Leave a Comment Read more: Celebrity Celebrity Relationships Close

All About Shawn Johnson and Andrew East's 3 Kids The retired gymnast and former NFL star are parents to Drew Hazel, Jett James and Barrett Madison By Blake Bakkila Blake Bakkila Blake Bakkila is a contributing writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2023. Her work has appeared in Sunset.com, ArchitecturalDigest.com, and GoodHousekeeping.com. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on October 29, 2024 09:18AM EDT Leave a Comment Shawn Johnson and Andrew East with their kids, daughter Drew Hazel East and son Jett James East. Credit : Shawn Johnson Instagram Shawn Johnson and Andrew East are accomplished former athletes, and they’re also parents to three kids — Drew, Jett and Barrett. Their paths crossed when the gold medal-winning gymnast retired in 2012, and she met her now-husband shortly after. Fast forward, Shawn and Andrew got married in 2016 in Tennessee. Following their nuptials, Shawn suffered a miscarriage just two days after finding out she was expecting in 2017. The couple shared an emotional YouTube video talking about the experience. “The past 48 hours have been some of the happiest, scariest, and saddest times of my life,” she wrote in the video's description. “My husband Andrew and I found out that we were unexpectedly pregnant, only to find out hours later some tragic news. I have been crying more than I ever have, but am still optimistic for what is next.” Shawn Johnson with her husband Andrew East and their kids, daughter Drew Hazel East and son Jett James East, at Disney. Shawn Johnson East/instagram In 2019, Shawn and Andrew welcomed their first child, a daughter named Drew Hazel. The couple then celebrated the arrival of their son, Jett James, in 2021. Most recently, they welcomed their third child, a baby boy named Barrett Madison in December 2023. "Our baby boy has finally arrived, and we couldn't be more thrilled," Shawn and Andrew told PEOPLE in a statement. "Both baby and mom are doing great, and we are counting our blessings!" Here's everything to know about Shawn Johnson and Andrew East's kids: Drew, Jett and Barrett. Drew Hazel East, 5 Shawn Johnson and Andrew East's daughter Drew Hazel East in a pool. Shawn Johnson Instagram The couple announced they were pregnant in April 2019 in a YouTube video. “@theeastbaby ... we cannot WAIT to welcome you to the world and shower you with love. @andrewdeast WE DID IT!” Shawn wrote alongside a photo of her and Andrew pointing at her belly on Instagram. Six months later, Drew Hazel was born on Oct. 29, 2019, weighing in at 8 lbs., 8 oz. and measuring 20.5 inches long. According to Shawn's Instagram post sharing the news, Drew's name is a nod to Andrew. “Named after the most incredible person I know ... her daddy,” she captioned an Instagram picture of them kissing Drew. Throughout the years, the couple have shared her milestones and other sweet moments — from meeting her icon, Blippi, to becoming a big sister. Nicknamed “Roo,” Drew is “definitely daddy's girl through and through,” Shawn wrote on Instagram in 2020. Another highlight was the full-circle moment when Shawn took her family to meet her longtime former gymnastics coach, Liang Chow, in 2022. During their visit, Drew showed signs that she might be into her mom’s sport and took a particular interest in the trampoline. "The fun part, once she started warming up, she was just running, zig-zagging all over the gym," Shawn said in a different YouTube video. "She was like 'Mama, beam.' 'Mama, bars.' 'Mama, trampoline.' 'Mama, vault.' " Jett James East, 2 Shawn Johnson and Andrew East's son Jett James East posing next to a tree. Shawn Johnson Instagram Shawn shared the news about baby No. 2 on Instagram with four words, “Here we go again.” The January 2021 announcement included photos of her bump and Drew holding a tiny pair of sneakers. On July 19, 2021, Shawn and Andrew's son Jett James East was born. “We are so happy to welcome our little man into the world,” they said in an exclusive statement to PEOPLE. “We are loving life as a family of four and soaking up every minute." A few days later, they provided more details about their second baby on their YouTube channel. Jett measured 21 inches long and weighed 9 lbs., 13 oz., and Shawn also opened up about his name on Instagram. Jett James combines her great-great-great grandmother’s and her husband’s brother’s names. These days, Jett is on the move — especially when it’s less than convenient for his parents. In October 2023, Andrew shared a video showing Jett escaping from his pack-and-play in the middle of the night. “He wasn’t even 2 when he did this. all hands on deck w this guy,” the former NFL star quipped in the Instagram caption. In fact, Jett and Drew have started working together to learn about babyproofing, as seen in an Instagram video of the brother and sister duo figuring out how to undo safety locks. “Plz help,” Andrew wrote. Barrett Madison East Shawn Johnson announces she's expecting another baby with husband Andrew East. Shawn Johnson Instagram During a family trip to Greece in July 2023, Shawn posted several bump photos on Instagram to announce that she was pregnant. According to her, Drew and Jett were looking forward to having another sibling. "Drew is very, very excited and she talks about it daily or kisses my belly daily or something. It's adorable," she told PEOPLE. Shawn and Andrew announced the news that their third baby had been born via cesarian section in December 2023. "The third time around feels so surreal because even though we've done this twice before, there's still so much nervousness and excitement around the days leading up to the birth and then so much magic once you get to hold your sweet baby in your arms for the first time," Shawn said when she announced the baby's birth in her FamilyMade newsletter. Andrew added, "My dad was born on December 9 and passed away unexpectedly on December 27 of last year, so December is a really impactful month for us. Having our baby born so close to my dad's birthday feels really special and I know he would be smiling down and so proud of us." Shawn and Andrew chose to keep their baby's sex and name private after his arrival and announced the details while sharing new photos on Instagram that included their family's newest member. "Barrett 'Bear' Madison East," Shawn wrote in the caption. "We've all been waiting for you." Close Leave a Comment Read more: Celebrity Celebrity Family Celebrity Kids

Brittany Cartwright Reacts to Ex Jax Taylor's Departure from The Valley, Says Their Relationship Is 'Horrible' Cartwright said there is "no trust whatsoever" between her and her ex right now By Julia Moore Julia Moore Julia Moore is a TV writer-reporter at PEOPLE. A graduate of Northwestern University, she has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. People Editorial Guidelines Published on July 23, 2025 01:10PM EDT 5 Comments Jax Taylor (left), Brittany Cartwright (right). Credit : Andrew Chin/Getty, Steve Granitz/FilmMagic NEED TO KNOW Vibes between estranged exes Brittany Cartwright and Jax Taylor are not goodCartwright weighed in on the news that Taylor is not returning for season 3 of The Valley on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, a week after Taylor broke the newsIn a statement, Taylor said he was "stepping away" from the show to focus on "my sobriety, my mental health and my coparenting relationship" Things are tense between exes Brittany Cartwright and Jax Taylor. During an appearance on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen on July 22, Cartwright, 36, spoke out on her ex-husband's recent departure from The Valley, which a source previously told PEOPLE "blindsided" the show's cast. In a statement on July 16, Taylor, 46, said he was "stepping away" from The Valley ahead of season 3 "after an incredibly challenging year and many honest conversations with my team and producers." "Right now, my focus needs to be on my sobriety, my mental health, and coparenting relationship," he said in the statement shared with Variety. "Taking this time is necessary for me to become the best version of myself — especially for our son, Cruz." Cartwright is in support of her ex's decision to exit the show. When Andy Cohen asked if she had a heads up about Taylor's departure, Cartwright said she "found out the night before" his statement was released. "And I was like, that was a great decision. By everyone." Jax Taylor and Brittany Cartwright on 'Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen'. Charles Sykes/Bravo via Getty She described her relationship with him right now as "horrible" and said there is "no trust whatsoever," as she revealed he is not in therapy and is still not contributing to the mortgage on their former home or expenses related to their 4-year-old son. As for his sobriety — he claimed he's 201 days sober and is regularly drug tested on Watch What Happens Live last month — Cartwright said, "He's sober from some things, but not all things. I'll just say that." Unlike Cartwright, the rest of The Valley cast did not have a heads-up about Taylor's exit. Per a source, the cast was "absolutely blindsided" by Taylor's July 16 statement. "They were not given any advance notifications about his exit." Related Stories Jax Taylor Says He Is 'Feeling Great' amid Sobriety and 'Will Not Touch Drugs and Alcohol Again' (Exclusive) Brittany Cartwright Filed for Divorce After Jax Taylor Lied About Urgent Care Trip and Told Her Their House Was in Foreclosure "Most of the cast were notified that filming was going to begin at the end of the summer, and they expected Jax would be a part of the new season because — even as lately as yesterday — he hadn't said otherwise. This is a huge surprise." Cohen is also on board with Taylor's decision to leave the show. He told PEOPLE after the news broke that it was a "good decision" by Taylor. "I think he needs to work out s--- without cameras around," Cohen, 57, said. Brittany Cartwright and Jax Taylor on 'Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen'. Charles Sykes/Bravo/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal/Getty On his radio show, Andy Cohen Live, the host said that he had a "serious conversation" with Taylor "about his need for control and his anger issues, and what it's going to take to get to a better place with Brittany and in the world" at the season 2 reunion. "I hope he takes the time to lean into this, away from the cameras," Cohen said.Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. The Valley reunion drops July 29 on Bravo. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment TV Reality TV

Teresa Giudice's 4 Daughters: All About Gia, Gabriella, Milania and Audriana Real Housewives of New Jersey star Teresa Giudice shares four daughters with her ex-husband Joe By Jamie Ballard Jamie Ballard Jamie Ballard is a contributing writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. Her work has previously been featured in Cosmopolitan, Woman’s Day and Good Housekeeping. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on February 3, 2025 09:37AM EST Leave a Comment Teresa Giudice with her daughters. Credit : Manny Carabel/Getty Teresa Giudice's kids have grown up on camera. The Real Housewives of New Jersey star shares four daughters with her ex-husband Joe Giudice: Gia, 23, Gabriella, 20, Milania, 19, and Audriana, 15. All four girls have appeared on the Bravo series alongside their mother — Teresa's youngest, Audriana, was even born on camera. In 2013, Teresa and Joe were indicted for tax fraud and both served time in federal prison. During Joe's 41-month prison sentence, a court ordered his deportation (Joe was born in Italy and never obtained United States citizenship, despite moving to the U.S. as a child) and he moved to Italy in October 2019. The former couple split a few months later and their divorce was finalized the following year. In August 2022, Teresa married Luis Ruelas in a lavish New Jersey ceremony and all four of her daughters were a part of her bridal party. "The girls embrace Louie, and it's beautiful," Teresa later told PEOPLE of her children's relationship with her new husband. Earlier that year, Teresa received praise from then-pregnant Rihanna, who said in an interview with ELLE that she admired the RHONJ star's parenting style. "Teresa from New Jersey does not play about her kids," Rihanna said. "She will flatten you about those kids. And that resonates with me a lot because I feel like that's the type of mom I'm going to be." Teresa reacted to Rihanna's comments on Bravo's The Daily Dish, saying, "It shows that, you know, people see that I am a good mom," Teresa said. "Because sometimes you don't know if you're doing a good job as a mom. But then when I look at my daughters, I'm like, 'Yes, I'm doing a good job.' " Here's everything to know about Teresa Giudice's four daughters. Gia Giudice, 24 Charles Sykes/Bravo/NBCU Photo Bank Teresa's eldest daughter, Gia, was born on Jan. 8, 2001. Gia was 8 years old when RHONJ premiered and has been in front of the cameras ever since. In season 3, a then-10-year-old Gia tearfully performed an original song for her family about the issues her mother and uncle were facing at the time. Years later, the clip resurfaced on TikTok and the lyrics, "waking up in the morning, thinking about so many things," turned into a viral trend. "This is gonna haunt me my whole life," Gia joked in one comment. Now 24 years old, Gia is a graduate of Rutgers University, where she studied criminal justice with plans to become a lawyer. Ahead of Gia's junior year in 2021, Teresa spoke with PEOPLE about her daughter, saying, "I really try to encourage Gia. Encouraging your kids is important. Being there for them and supporting them is important, too. Anytime Rutgers had something for the parents, I went. Parents weekend. Tailgates. I went to her football games. It was fun." Teresa Giudice/instagram Following Gia's graduation from Rutgers in May 2023, Teresa posted about the milestone on Instagram. "I am so proud of my devoted and intelligent daughter, Gia, for graduating a stellar university, a huge milestone to accomplish in life. Seeing you graduate college is one of the most special moments in my life," the reality star captioned a photo of her and Gia. In February 2023, Gia landed a job with attorney Kathleen Martinez, who specializes in immigration law. "She wants to help immigrants more than people realize," Martinez commented on a TikTok announcing Gia's post-undergraduate plans. "Her heart is so big for that." Gia Giudice Instagram When Teresa joined Dancing With the Stars in September 2022, Gia was quick to celebrate her mother on Instagram, writing, "I grew up watching this show with my family and it is so surreal that my mom is now going to be on it. I am so proud of you, you're going to kill it.. can't wait to watch you this season! everyone go vote❤️." Gia has continued to appear on RHONJ alongside her mother and sisters. When Teresa began dating Ruelas, Gia expressed her initial reservations during a confessional, saying, "Do I think my mom might be moving too fast? Yeah. Any relationship you're gonna be in the honeymoon stage for the beginning. It's very easy to only see the good when you're in la la land." During the same season, she got into a fight with her uncle, Joe Gorga, over comments he had made about her father. The pair later talked it out, and in a confessional Gia added she would "try to move on." Gia has also been in a relationship with her boyfriend Christian Carmichael since 2020. Gabriella Giudice, 20 Teresa Giudice/Instagram Gabriella Giudice was born on Oct. 4, 2004. Teresa's second daughter seems to be more private than the rest of her family, as she doesn't appear to have any public social media profiles. In 2016, Teresa told PEOPLE that the then-11-year-old would love to be a professional soccer player or a model. Years later, Teresa told The Daily Dish that Gabriella was starting to look at colleges ahead of her senior year of high school. "At first, she wanted to be a CIA agent, and then she saw how much money they made, and now she's changed her mind," Teresa said in May 2022. "I can't wait to see what college she goes to, because she is my smartest kid. I can't wait to start looking at colleges with her and see where she ends up." Dave Kotinsky/Getty In June 2022, Teresa congratulated Gabriella on her academic achievements, posting a picture of awards that Gabriella received in multiple subjects. "My beautiful Gabriella ❤️ you never cease to amaze me," Teresa wrote. "I'm so proud of what you've accomplished. We all see the amount of effort and hard [work] you put you put into everything you do! I'm a super proud mom today and everyday ❤️ Love you beyond words." After graduating high school, Gabriella committed to the University of Michigan where she began classes in September 2023. For Gabriella's 19th birthday, Teresa celebrated her daughter on Instagram, writing, "This is my first birthday away from you, but don’t worry I will see you very soon to celebrate and give you the biggest hug! You amaze me every day with your accomplishments and hard work." The RHONJ star continued, "As a mom, all I want is for you to be happy and I am so thankful that the university of Michigan was the perfect fit for you; the school was made for you. I hope this year brings you nothing but joy and happiness." Milania Giudice, 19 Milania Giudice Instagram Teresa's third daughter, Milania Giudice, was born on Feb. 2, 2006. Though she is widely known as Teresa's daughter, Milania has big aspirations of her own. In 2016, PEOPLE interviewed then-10-year-old Milania about her YouTube channel. "My friend and I always wanted to be actresses and stuff," she said. "We always wanted to do fun things on YouTube, 'cause we would always watch videos, so we put a video together and we edited it. It was really cool." The same year, Milania walked the runway at New York Fashion Week. Two years later, Teresa reiterated her daughter's acting dreams. "Milania keeps telling me, 'Mah, I wanna be in movies. You did it with Gia, you won't do it with me,' " Teresa said. "The reason why I don't do it [is] 'cause I'm so busy and I don't know, I want to but it's like, you don't want to be on TV. Look what happened to me." Milania Giudice Instagram In 2019, Milania released her single "I Just Can't Wait to Grow Up." The song made its official debut during an episode of RHONJ, in which Teresa declared, "I think the song is so catchy! I really think it's going to be a No. 1!" Milania also supported her mom as she prepared for her stint on DWTS in 2022. "She's watched Audriana at every dance competition," Milania told PEOPLE. "She's watched a million dancers. I think she's got it. I believe in her. I think my mom could win anything." Before Teresa and Ruelas' wedding, Milania shared a photo from her mom's bridal shower. "The most beautiful bride to be… i love you mommy," Milania wrote. Teresa shared the same photo and wrote, "Built in best friends ... To the moon & back I love you girls!" Like her siblings, Milania often appears RHONJ and got involved in some drama during season 12. While her uncle Joe and older sister Gia (mostly) made up, Milania wasn't so quick to forgive her uncle. During a party at Ruelas' house, the family brought up the incident. "Obviously, I'm hurt over what happened," Milania said. "Just seeing someone scream at my mom and saying things about my dad, I've never seen someone scream at someone like that. I cannot watch that." Joe apologized to Milania after hearing how she was affected by the incident. "Listen, I apologize. I don't want to argue anymore," he said. "This family's been through a lot and we can all be angry because we've all hurt but then we love. Let's love. Let's not ruin our family." In May 2024, Teresa and Milania shared that she had decided to attend the University of Tampa in the fall with an Instagram post that showed the mother and daughter sitting together on a bed, totally decked out in the school's gear. "Congratulations on the University of Tampa! I love you so much and I am so proud of you! I can’t wait to see what you accomplish within your four years, make mommy proud❤️ ," Teresa wrote. Audriana Giudice, 15 Audriana Giudice Instagram The youngest of Teresa's four daughters, Audriana Giudice, was born on Sept. 14, 2009. Audriana had a particularly difficult time when her father was imprisoned and later deported to Italy. In 2019, Teresa and Gia shared that then-9-year-old Audriana was bullied at school because of her father. The same year, however, the Giudice sisters and Teresa were able to visit Joe in Italy. The youngest Giudice is also a competitive dancer and gave her mom advice before DWTS. "She's like 'Mommy, don't be scared. Have fun, most important, have fun. Feel your partner's energy, and dance like it's your last time dancing,' " Teresa shared. Teresa Giudice Instagram In addition to dance, Audriana has also modeled with her sister Milania. In 2016, the sisters both walked at NYFW, according to Bravo. "That was her first time doing anything like that and she loved it, she was so good," Teresa said of her youngest. "She likes the cameras too. And Audriana was really born in front of the cameras." In September 2023, Teresa celebrated Audriana's 14th birthday by sharing an Instagram Reel featuring photos of her daughter throughout the years. "You impress me everyday! Keep being your authentic self. I hope this year brings you nothing but joy and happiness. I love you to the moon and back❤️🌙 🎂🎊🎉🎈😘," the reality star wrote in the caption. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Celebrity Celebrity Family Celebrity Kids

argos_summary: Gia Giudice discussed the dynamics of the cast on the upcoming season of 'Special Forces: World's Toughest Test' during her podcast, hinting at tensions with Kody Brown, a fellow cast member. She noted that while she got along with most of the cast, some individuals, presumably including Kody, would 'get under your skin.' This sentiment was echoed by Brianna 'Chickenfry' LaPaglia, who admitted to not getting along well with Kody during filming. The season is set to premiere on September 25, featuring a diverse cast of celebrities.
